meanings.definition: A specialized light-emitting organ found in certain marine organisms.
meanings.sent1: The photophores of deep-sea creatures help them glow in the dark ocean.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the photophores of jellyfish to understand their bioluminescence.
meanings.sent3: The playful octopus used its photophores to create a light show for its friends.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room like a cluster of photophores in the night.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious underwater world was illuminated by the tiny photophores of the fish.

meanings.definition: The light-producing cells or organs in bioluminescent organisms.
meanings.sent1: Bioluminescent organisms use their photophores to communicate in the dark.
meanings.sent2: The deep-sea anglerfish has a glowing lure on its photophores to attract prey.
meanings.sent3: The firefly's photophores blinked rhythmically, creating a mesmerizing display.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline at night resembled a field of photophores scattered across the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The forest at night was alive with the soft glow of countless photophores.
